author: jochembrouwer
content: Hi <@892053833121923094> <@755913785620824175> , I just ran the v4 tests on EthereumJS (one failing test, so looking (almost) good). I was wondering though if there is  a test where there is a post-4844 fork header test where the `dataGasUsed` field is undefined (there are some at the ShanghaiToCancunAtTime15k tests which have headers with `excessDataGas` undefined, but I can't seem to find a test where it tests this scenario for the other (so `dataGasUsed`))

author: jochembrouwer
content: Ok, we now pass all fixtures ðŸ™‚

author: techbro_ccoli
content: Nice catch! I don't think we have one for this! We are planning to add tests for > uint64 `excessDataGas`/`dataGasUsed` header fields, so we could add specific undefined tests alongside these! ðŸ˜„

author: marioevz
content:
I sneakily added those tests in this PR over here yesterday: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/151/commits/0102a7ab121d63ccdaf93150a4fdaf2e36b143f3

Tests all possible combinations pre and post merge of missing/present fields for excessDataGas and dataGasUsed ðŸ‘Œ
